NNC.7 Non-Normal Checklists-Engines, APU
                      ABORTED ENGINE START

Condition: One or more of the following conditions:
 • No N1 rotation before the engine start lever is raised to IDLE
 • No oil pressure indication by the time the engine is stabilized at idle
 • No increase in EGT, within 10 seconds on the ground or 30 seconds in
   flight, after the engine start lever is raised to IDLE
 • No increase in, or a very slow increase in N1 or N2 after EGT indication
 • EGT rapidly approaching or exceeding the start limit.
 Before engine start lever raised to IDLE:
     ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 After engine start lever raised to IDLE:
     Before starter cutout:
         ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
           Continue to motor the engine for 60 seconds.
             [Clears fuel and cools engine components.]

         ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
     After starter cutout:
         ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
         After N2 decreases to below 20%:
             ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . GRD
               Motor the engine for 60 seconds.
                 [Clears fuel and cools engine components.]

             ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF




                       Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
December 1, 2000                 D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.7.1
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

                                      APU DET INOP

Condition: The APU DET INOP light illuminated indicates the
            APU fire detection loop has failed.
 APU SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 CAUTION: Do not operate the APU. An APU fire would not
          be detected and the APU would continue to run.


                  APU FAULT/LOW OIL PRESSURE

Condition: The APU FAULT/LOW OIL PRESSURE light
            illuminated indicates an APU malfunction exists.
 Note: The APU shuts down automatically.
 APU SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF


                                            APU FIRE

Condition: Fire is detected in the APU.

 APU FIRE WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . PULL & ROTATE
   Rotate to the stop and hold for one second. To manually
   unlock the APU fire warning switch, press the override
   and pull.
 APU SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 If the fire warning switch remains illuminated:
     In flight:
         Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
     On the ground:
         STANDBY POWER SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . BAT




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.2                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 08, 2001
                                                                                    Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                            Engines, APU
                                 737 Operations Manual

                               APU OVERSPEED

Condition: The APU OVERSPEED light illuminated indicates one
           of the following:
• APU RPM limit has been exceeded resulting in an automatic shutdown
• the overspeed shutdown protection feature has failed a self-test during a
  normal APU shutdown
• an APU start has been manually aborted prior to the APU reaching
  normal operating speed.
 APU SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 Note: If the OVERSPEED light illuminated due to an RPM
       limit being exceeded, the APU OVERSPEED RESET
       switch in the E/E compartment must be reset before
       another APU start can be attempted.




                      Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 08, 2001                   D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.7.3
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual




                                           Intentionally
                                               Blank




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.4                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 08, 2001
                                                                                     Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                             Engines, APU
                                  737 Operations Manual

                   ENGINE FAILURE/SHUTDOWN

Condition: Loss of thrust on an engine as indicated by the engine
            indicators, or abnormal engine indications.
 Accomplish an engine shutdown only when flight
 conditions permit.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
    [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
    [Assists in recognition of affected engine.]

 Conditions permitting, operate for three minutes at idle
 thrust.
 ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 APU (if available) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . START & ON BUS
 PACK SWITCH (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
    [Causes operating pack to regulate to high flow in flight with flaps up.]

 FUEL . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .BALANCE
 TRANSPONDER MODE SELECTOR
 (TCAS equipped airplanes) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . TA
    [Prevents climb commands which can exceed single engine performance
    capability.]

 If wing anti–ice is required:
    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
 Accomplish the ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE LANDING
 checklist.




                       Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                    D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.7.5
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual


                  ENGINE FIRE, SEVERE DAMAGE
                        OR SEPARATION

Condition: Fire is detected in the associated engine; severe
            damage which may be associated with airframe
            vibration and/or abnormal engine indications has
            occurred; or the engine has separated.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
     [Assists in recognition of the afftected engine.]

 ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 ENGINE FIRE WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . PULL
   To manually unlock the engine fire warning switch, press
   the override and pull.
 If the engine fire warning switch or ENG OVERHEAT light
 remains illuminated:
     ENGINE FIRE WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . .ROTATE L or R
       Rotate to the stop and hold for one second.
     If after 30 seconds the engine fire warning switch or ENG
     OVERHEAT light remains illuminated:
         ENGINE FIRE
         WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ROTATE TO
                                                 REMAINING BOTTLE
           Rotate to the opposite stop and hold for one
           second.
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.6                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                     Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                             Engines, APU
                                  737 Operations Manual
                            Continued from previous page
 If high airframe vibration occurs and continues after engine
 is shut down:
    Without delay, reduce airspeed and descend to a safe
    altitude which results in an acceptable vibration level. If
    high vibration returns and further airspeed reduction and
    descent are not practicable, increasing airspeed may
    reduce vibration.
 ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
 PACK SWITCH (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
    [Causes operating pack to regulate to high flow in flight with flaps up.]

 APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 APU (if available) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . START & ON BUS
 FUEL . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .BALANCE
 TRANSPONDER MODE SELECTOR
 (TCAS equipped airplanes) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . TA
    [Prevents climb commands which can exceed single engine performance
    capability.]

 If wing anti–ice is required:
    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH (after fire has been
    extinguished) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
 Accomplish the ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE LANDING
 checklist when appropriate.


                       ENGINE FIRE/OVERHEAT
                         DETECTOR FAULT

Condition: The FAULT light illuminated indicates both loops on
            an engine have failed.
 The fire detection system in one or both engines is
 inoperative.

                       Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                    D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.7.7
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual




                                           Intentionally
                                               Blank




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.8                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Engines, APU
                               737 Operations Manual

                ENGINE HIGH OIL TEMPERATURE

Condition: Engine oil temperature is in the yellow band, or at or
          above the red radial.
 If temperature is at or above the red radial:
    Accomplish the ENGINE FAILURE/SHUTDOWN checklist.
 If temperature is in the yellow band:
    AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
        [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

    THRUST LEVER (affected engine) . . . . . . . . . . . . . RETARD
      Retard until engine oil temperature is within normal
      operating range or thrust lever is closed.
    If temperature is in the yellow band for more than 15
    minutes:
        Accomplish the ENGINE FAILURE/SHUTDOWN
        checklist.




                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                 D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.7.9
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

                     ENGINE LIMIT/SURGE/STALL

Condition: One or more of the following conditions:
 • Engine RPM or EGT indications are abnormal, approaching or exceeding
   limits
 • No response to thrust lever movement
 • Abnormal engine noises.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . RETARD
   Retard until indications remain within appropriate limits
   or thrust lever is closed.
 If indications are abnormal or EGT continues to increase:
     ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
     APU (If available) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . START & ON BUS
     PACK SWITCH (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
         [Causes operating pack to regulate to high flow in flight with flaps up.]

     FUEL . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .BALANCE
     TRANSPONDER MODE SELECTOR
     (TCAS equipped airplanes) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . TA
         [Prevents climb commands which can exceed single engine
         performance capability.]

     If wing anti-ice is required:
         ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
     Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
     Accomplish the ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE LANDING
     checklist.
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.10                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                 Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                         Engines, APU
                              737 Operations Manual
                        Continued from previous page
 If indications are stabilized and EGT decreases:
    THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ADVANCE
      Advance slowly. Check that RPM and EGT follow
      thrust lever movement.
      Operate engine normally or at a reduced thrust setting
      which is surge and stall free.


                 ENGINE LOW OIL PRESSURE

Condition: Engine oil pressure is in the yellow band with takeoff
          thrust set, LOW OIL PRESSURE light illuminated, or
          engine oil pressure is at or below the red radial.
 If engine oil pressure is in the yellow band with takeoff
 thrust set:
    DO NOT TAKEOFF.
 If engine oil pressure is at or below the red radial:
    Accomplish the ENGINE FAILURE/SHUTDOWN checklist.




                   Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.7.11
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

                     ENGINE OIL FILTER BYPASS

Condition: The engine OIL FILTER BYPASS light illuminated
            indicates an impending bypass of the scavenge oil
            filter.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . RETARD
   Retard until the OIL FILTER BYPASS light extinguishes or
   thrust lever is closed.
 If the OIL FILTER BYPASS light extinguishes:
     Operate the engine at reduced thrust to keep the light
     extinguished.
 If the OIL FILTER BYPASS light remains illuminated:
     Accomplish the ENGINE FAILURE/SHUTDOWN checklist.


                                ENGINE OVERHEAT

Condition: The ENG OVERHEAT light illuminated indicates an
            overheat is detected on the related engine.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
 If the ENG OVERHEAT light remains illuminated:
     Accomplish the ENGINE FIRE, SEVERE DAMAGE OR
     SEPARATION checklist.
 If the ENG OVERHEAT light extinguishes:
     Operate the engine at reduced thrust to keep the light
     extinguished.



                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.12                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Engines, APU
                               737 Operations Manual

                       ENGINE TAILPIPE FIRE

Condition: Tailpipe fire is reported with no engine fire warning.

 ENGINE START LEVER. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 If bleed air is available:
    PACK SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
        [Allows maximum bleed air for engine motoring.]

    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
    ENGINE No. 1 and No. 2
    BLEED AIR SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .VERIFY ON
    If APU is operating:
        APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
    If engine start switch is OFF/CONT:
        Allow N2 to decrease below 20%.
    ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . GRD
      Motor engine until tailpipe fire is reported
      extinguished.
    ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 TOWER AND FLIGHT ATTENDANTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . NOTIFY




                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                 D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.7.13
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual




                                           Intentionally
                                               Blank




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.14                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                   Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                           Engines, APU
                                737 Operations Manual

                     HIGH ENGINE VIBRATION

Condition: VIB levels are in excess of 4.0 units accompanied by
          airframe vibrations.
 If not in icing conditions:
    AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
        [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

    THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . RETARD
      Retard to maintain VIB below 4 units.
    Note: If the VIB indication does not decrease when the
          thrust lever is retarded, check other engine
          indications. If other engine indications are normal,
          no further action is required.
 If in icing conditions:
    During descent or holding accomplish the following on
    one engine at a time at approximately 15 minute
    intervals:
    ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . FLT
    THRUST . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ADJUST
      Adjust thrust to 45% N1. After approximately five
      seconds, advance thrust lever slowly to a minimum of
      80% N1.
    If vibration does not decrease:
        Accomplish the procedure for “If not in icing
        conditions.”




                     Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                  D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.7.15
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

                          INFLIGHT ENGINE START

Condition: Engine start is desired after a shutdown with no fire or
            apparent damage.
 Complete the ENGINE FAILURE AND SHUTDOWN checklist
 before attempting an inflight engine start.
 INFLIGHT START ENVELOPE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECK
 CAUTION: Starter assist should be used if N2 is below 15%.
 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
 ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 If starter assist is required:
     PACK SWITCH (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
     DUCT PRESSURE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . MINIMUM 30 PSI
       If required, advance the thrust lever to increase duct
       pressure.
     IGNITION SELECT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . BOTH
 ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . GRD/FLT
 ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .IDLE DETENT
   Position engine start lever to IDLE detent at a minimum of
   15% N2.
 If no increase in EGT is observed within 30 seconds:
     ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
     ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 After engine start:
     ELECTRICAL . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . GENERATOR ON
     PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
     ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
     APU . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
                                    Continued on next page
                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.16                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                                        Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                                                Engines, APU
                                                     737 Operations Manual
                                               Continued from previous page
 After engine start: (continued)
    TRANSPONDER MODE SELECTOR
    (TCAS equipped airplanes) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . TA/RA


                                                 INFLIGHT START ENVELOPE

                                                    INDICATED AIRSPEED - KNOTS

Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

              LOSS OF THRUST ON BOTH ENGINES

Condition: Loss of all thrust on both engines or loss of thrust
            lever response from both engines.
 ENGINE START SWITCHES. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . FLT
 ENGINE START LEVERS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 EGT decreasing:
     ENGINE START LEVERS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .IDLE DETENT
 If EGT reaches 930°C, repeat the above steps.
 Note: In moderate to heavy rain it may take up to 3 minutes
        to accelerate to idle.
 APU (if available) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . START & ON BUS
   Do not wait for successful engine start(s) prior to starting
   APU.
     [The APU has demonstrated the capability to provide electrical and
     pneumatic power up to 20,000 feet.]

 If neither restart is successful and N2 is below 15%:
     WING ANTI–ICE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
     PACK SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
     APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ON
     IGNITION SELECT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . BOTH
     EITHER ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . GRD
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.18                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                    Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                            Engines, APU
                                 737 Operations Manual
                           Continued from previous page
 When engine parameters have stabilized:
    APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
    ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . FLT
    THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ADVANCE
    ENGINE GENERATOR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
    PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
 Accomplish the INFLIGHT ENGINE START checklist to start
 the other engine.
 If neither IRS attitude display recovers after a generator bus
 is restored:
    IRS MODE SELECTOR SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ATT
      Maintain straight and level, constant airspeed flight
       until attitude displays recover (approximately 30
       seconds).
    MAGNETIC HEADING . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ENTER
 APU . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED


                                        LOW IDLE

Condition: The LOW IDLE light illuminated indicates the related
           engine is below minimum required RPM.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
    [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVERS . . . . . . . . . . . . ADVANCE THRUST LEVERS
                                      UNTIL LIGHT EXTINGUISHES




                      Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                   D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.7.19
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

              ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE LANDING

Condition: Landing must be accomplished with one engine
            inoperative.
 Plan a flaps 15 landing.
 Set VREF 15.
 Maintain VREF 15 + 5 knots minimum on final approach.
 Apply normal wind correction but do not go below VREF 15
 + 5 knots to assure adequate speed for go-around.
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> DESCENT – APPROACH
 ANTI–ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
   Use engine anti–ice on the operative engine only.
 AIR CONDITIONING AND PRESSURIZATION . . . . . . . . . . SET
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.20                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                    Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                            Engines, APU
                                 737 Operations Manual
                           Continued from previous page
 If additional go–around thrust is desired, below 10,000 feet
 configure the pressurization system for a no engine bleed
 landing:
    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
    ENGINE No. 1 BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
    APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
      Do not open the APU bleed valve if the engine fire
      warning switch remains illuminated.
    LEFT PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
    ENGINE No. 2 BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 ALTIMETERS AND
 INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET & X–CHECKED
 N1 AND IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . .CHECKED & SET, VREF 15
 GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
 INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .FLAP INHIBIT
 GO–AROUND PROCEDURE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . REVIEW
    Accomplish normal go–around procedure except:
    • Use flaps 1
    • Maintain VREF 15 + 5 knots to flap retraction altitude
    • Limit bank angle to 15 degrees until reaching VREF 15
      + 15 knots or minimum maneuver speed
    • Accelerate to flaps 1 maneuvering speed prior to flap
      retraction.
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> LANDING
 ENGINE START
 SWITCH (operating engine) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
 RECALL. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED
 SPEED BRAKE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED, GREEN LIGHT
 LANDING GEAR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . DOWN, 3 GREEN
 FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 15, GREEN LIGHT

Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual


                 POWER MANAGEMENT CONTROL
                     (PMC) INOPERATIVE

Condition: The power management control INOP light
            illuminated indicates the PMC is inoperative or OFF.
 THRUST LEVERS (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ADJUST
   Flight may continue with the autothrottle ON.
   In manual operation, adjust the thrust levers as required.
 Observe engine limits.


                                          REVERSER

Condition: The REVERSER light illuminated indicates a fault is
        detected in the related engine reverser system.
 Note: Additional system failures may cause inflight
       deployment.
 Expect normal reverser operation after landing.




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.22                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Engines, APU
                               737 Operations Manual

                REVERSER UNLOCKED (IN FLIGHT)

Condition: The REVERSER UNLOCKED light illuminated
          indicates that either of the two reverser sleeves has
          mechanically unlocked or that the REVERSER
          UNLOCKED light is giving a false indication.
 Note: Only multiple failures could allow the engine to go
       into reverse thrust.
 Note: Unstowed reverser sleeves produce buffet, yaw, roll
       and increased airplane drag.
 FORWARD THRUST LEVER (affected engine) . . . . . . CHECK
 CAUTION: Do not actuate the reverse thrust lever.
 If the engine responds to forward thrust lever movement
 and no buffet or yaw exists:
    Operate the engine normally.
 If the engine does not respond to forward thrust lever
 movement or buffet or yaw exists:
    Accomplish the ENGINE FAILURE/ SHUTDOWN
    checklist.




                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                 D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.7.23
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual




                                           Intentionally
                                               Blank




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.24                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                                   Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                           Engines, APU
                                737 Operations Manual

                           START VALVE OPEN

Condition: The START VALVE OPEN light illuminated indicates
          the start valve has opened or remains open after
          engine start.
 ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 If START VALVE OPEN light remains illuminated:
    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
    PACK SWITCH (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
        [Causes operating pack to regulate to high flow in flight with flaps up.]

    ENGINE BLEED AIR SWITCH (affected engine) . . . . . . OFF
    APU BLEED AIR SWITCH (engine No. 1 only) . . . . . . . OFF
    If during ground operations:
        GROUND AIR SOURCE (if in use) . . . . . . DISCONNECT
        ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF




                     Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                  D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.7.25
Non-Normal Checklists -
Engines, APU
                                     737 Operations Manual

                                     VOLCANIC ASH

Condition: Static discharge around the windshield, bright glow in
            the engine inlets, smoke or dust on the flight deck or
            an acrid odor indicates the airplane is in volcanic ash.
 Exit volcanic ash as quickly as possible. Consider a 180
 degree turn.
 OXYGEN MASKS AND SMOKE GOGGLES
 (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ON
 CREW COMMUNICATIONS
 (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ESTABLISH
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVERS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
   Conditions permitting, operate at idle thrust.
     [Reduces possible engine damage and/or flameout by decreasing EGT.]

 ENGINE START SWITCHES. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . FLT
 PACK SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . HIGH
 WING ANTI–ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ON
     [Increases bleed air extraction to improve engine stall margin.]

 ENGINE ANTI–ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ON
     [Increases bleed air extraction to improve engine stall margin.]

 APU (if available) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .START
     [Provides backup electrical and pneumatic source, if required.]
 Note: Encountering volcanic ash can lead to abnormal
       systems reactions such as:
       • Engine malfunctions, increasing EGT, engine stall
         or flameout.
       • Decrease or loss of airspeed indications.
       • Equipment cooling OFF light.
                                    Continued on next page



                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.7.26                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 07, 2002
                                                                               Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                       Engines, APU
                            737 Operations Manual
                      Continued from previous page
 If engines have flamed out or stalled, or EGT rapidly
 approaches or exceeds limit:
   Accomplish the LOSS OF THRUST ON BOTH ENGINES
   checklist.
 Note: Engines are very slow to accelerate to idle at high
       altitudes, which may be interpreted as a hung start or
       an engine malfunction.
 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.




                 Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.

Engines, APU

                                    737 Operations Manual
NNC.8 Non-Normal Checklists-Fire Protection
                 AIR CONDITIONING SMOKE/FUMES

Condition: A concentration of air conditioning smoke/fumes is
             identified.
  OXYGEN MASKS AND SMOKE GOGGLES
  (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
  CREW COMMUNICATIONS
  (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ESTABLISH
  RECIRCULATION FAN SWITCH(ES) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
      [Eliminates possible source of smoke/fumes.]

  If smoke/fumes stop:
      Continue flight with the recirculation fan switch(es) OFF.
  If smoke/fumes continue:
      ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
      R PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
      If smoke/fumes stop:
          Continue flight with the R PACK switch OFF and
          ISOLATION VALVE switch CLOSE.
      If smoke/fumes continue:
          R PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
          L PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
          If smoke/fumes stop:
              Continue flight with the L PACK switch OFF and
              ISOLATION VALVE switch CLOSE.
          If smoke/fumes continue:
              L PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
              Plan to land at nearest suitable airport.
  Accomplish the SMOKE/FUMES REMOVAL checklist, if
  required.

                         Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 08, 2001                      D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.8.1
Non-Normal Checklists -
Fire Protection
                                     737 Operations Manual

                                      APU DET INOP

Condition: The APU DET INOP light illuminated indicates the
            APU fire detection loop has failed.
 APU SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 CAUTION: Do not operate the APU. An APU fire would not
          be detected and the APU would continue to run.


                                            APU FIRE

Condition: Fire is detected in the APU.

 APU FIRE WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . PULL & ROTATE
   Rotate to the stop and hold for one second. To manually
   unlock the APU fire warning switch, press the override
   and pull.
 APU SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 If the fire warning switch remains illuminated:
     In flight:
         Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
     On the ground:
         STANDBY POWER SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . BAT




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.8.2                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  June 08, 2001
                                                                                   Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Fire Protection
                                737 Operations Manual

                                   CARGO FIRE

Condition: Fire is detected in the related cargo compartment.

 CARGO FIRE ARM SWITCH (FWD/AFT) . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED
 CARGO FIRE DISCHARGE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . PUSH
   Push and hold for 1 second.
 Note: DISCH light may require up to 30 seconds to
       illuminate.
 RECIRCULATION FAN SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 ONE PACK SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.


                CARGO FIRE DETECTOR FAULT

Condition: The DETECTOR FAULT light illuminated indicates
           both loops in one or both cargo compartments have
           failed.
 The fire detection system in one or both cargo
 compartments is inoperative.




                     Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 08, 2001                  D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.8.3
Non-Normal Checklists -
Fire Protection
                                     737 Operations Manual

              ELECTRICAL SMOKE/FUMES OR FIRE

Condition: Electrical smoke/fumes/fire is identified.

 OXYGEN MASKS AND SMOKE GOGGLES
 (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ON
 CREW COMMUNICATIONS
 (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ESTABLISH
 RECIRCULATION FAN SWITCH(ES) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
     [Removes fan as a possible source of smoke/fumes. Stops recirculation of
     smoke/fumes and increases fresh air flow.]

 If smoke/fumes/fire source is known:
     ELECTRICAL POWER
     (affected equipment) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .REMOVE
        If practical, remove power from affected equipment by
        switch or circuit breaker in flight deck or cabin.
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.8.4                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 07, 2001
                                                                                   Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Fire Protection
                                737 Operations Manual
                          Continued from previous page
 If smoke/fumes/fire persists or source is unknown:
    BUS TRANSFER SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
        [Prevents unwanted transfer of power.]

    GALLEY POWER SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
    EQUIPMENT COOLING SUPPLY/EXHAUST
    SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ALTERNATE
        [Removes normal fans as a possible source of smoke/fumes.]

    CABIN READING & GALLEY
    ATTENDANT WORK LIGHTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
      Instruct flight attendants to:
      • turn on cabin reading lights
      • turn on galley attendants work lights.
        [Prepares cabin lighting prior to depowering cabin fluorescent lights.]

    CABIN EQUIPMENT . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
      Instruct flight attendants to:
      • turn off galley power switches
      • turn off cabin fluorescent light switches.
    Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
 Accomplish the SMOKE/FUMES REMOVAL checklist, if
 required.


                     ENGINE FIRE/OVERHEAT
                       DETECTOR FAULT

Condition: The FAULT light illuminated indicates both loops on
          an engine have failed.
 The fire detection system in one or both engines is
 inoperative.




                     Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 08, 2001                  D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.8.5
Non-Normal Checklists -
Fire Protection
                                     737 Operations Manual


                  ENGINE FIRE, SEVERE DAMAGE
                        OR SEPARATION

Condition: Fire is detected in the associated engine; severe
            damage which may be associated with airframe
            vibration and/or abnormal engine indications has
            occurred; or the engine has separated.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
     [Assists in recognition of the afftected engine.]

 ENGINE START LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 ENGINE FIRE WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . PULL
   To manually unlock the engine fire warning switch, press
   the override and pull.
 If the engine fire warning switch or ENG OVERHEAT light
 remains illuminated:
     ENGINE FIRE WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . .ROTATE L or R
       Rotate to the stop and hold for one second.
     If after 30 seconds the engine fire warning switch or ENG
     OVERHEAT light remains illuminated:
         ENGINE FIRE
         WARNING SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ROTATE TO
                                                 REMAINING BOTTLE
           Rotate to the opposite stop and hold for one
           second.
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.8.6                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                     Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                            Fire Protection
                                  737 Operations Manual
                            Continued from previous page
 If high airframe vibration occurs and continues after engine
 is shut down:
    Without delay, reduce airspeed and descend to a safe
    altitude which results in an acceptable vibration level. If
    high vibration returns and further airspeed reduction and
    descent are not practicable, increasing airspeed may
    reduce vibration.
 ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
 PACK SWITCH (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
    [Causes operating pack to regulate to high flow in flight with flaps up.]

 APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 APU (if available) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . START & ON BUS
 FUEL . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .BALANCE
 TRANSPONDER MODE SELECTOR
 (TCAS equipped airplanes) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . TA
    [Prevents climb commands which can exceed single engine performance
    capability.]

 If wing anti–ice is required:
    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH (after fire has been
    extinguished) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
 Accomplish the ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE LANDING
 checklist when appropriate.




                       Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 07, 2002                    D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.8.7
Non-Normal Checklists -
Fire Protection
                                     737 Operations Manual

                                ENGINE OVERHEAT

Condition: The ENG OVERHEAT light illuminated indicates an
            overheat is detected on the related engine.
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
     [Allows thrust lever to remain where manually positioned.]

 THRUST LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
 If the ENG OVERHEAT light remains illuminated:
     Accomplish the ENGINE FIRE, SEVERE DAMAGE OR
     SEPARATION checklist.
 If the ENG OVERHEAT light extinguishes:
     Operate the engine at reduced thrust to keep the light
     extinguished.




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.8.8                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                         Fire Protection
                               737 Operations Manual

                       ENGINE TAILPIPE FIRE

Condition: Tailpipe fire is reported with no engine fire warning.

 ENGINE START LEVER. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOFF
 If bleed air is available:
    PACK SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
        [Allows maximum bleed air for engine motoring.]

    ISOLATION VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO
    ENGINE No. 1 and No. 2
    BLEED AIR SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .VERIFY ON
    If APU is operating:
        APU BLEED AIR SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
    If engine start switch is OFF/CONT:
        Allow N2 to decrease below 20%.
    ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . GRD
      Motor engine until tailpipe fire is reported
      extinguished.
    ENGINE START SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
 TOWER AND FLIGHT ATTENDANTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . NOTIFY


                           LAVATORY SMOKE

Condition: The SMOKE light illuminated indicates smoke is
          detected in one or more lavatories.
 Verify that lavatory fire is contained.




                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
June 08, 2001                 D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.8.9
Non-Normal Checklists -
Fire Protection
                                     737 Operations Manual

                          SMOKE/FUMES REMOVAL

Condition: Smoke/fumes removal is required.

 OXYGEN MASKS AND SMOKE GOGGLES
 (if required) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ON
 CABIN DOOR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CLOSE
     [Prevents smoke/fumes contamination of/from other compartments.]

 CREW COMMUNICATIONS (if required). . . . . . . . ESTABLISH
 If pack(s) are on and smoke/fumes source is confirmed to be
 on the flight deck or main cabin:
     L AND R PACK SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . HIGH
     RECIRCULATION FAN SWITCH(ES) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF
     PRESSURIZATION MODE SELECTOR . . . . . . . . . . . .STBY
     CABIN ALTITUDE INDICATOR
     (maximum 10,000 feet) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . INCREASE
         [Increases the ventilation rate.]

     CABIN RATE SELECTOR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . MAXIMUM INCR
     ENGINE No. 1 and No. 2
     BLEED AIR SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . VERIFY ON
     ENGINE THRUST . . . . . . . . . . . . MAXIMUM PRACTICAL N1
                                                   (minimum 45%)
         [Provides maximum cabin ventilation.]

     FLIGHT DECK AIR CONDITIONING AND
     GASPER OUTLETS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OPEN
     CAUTION: Do not open any flight deck window. Keep the
              cabin door closed.
     If smoke/fumes are uncontrollable:
         AIRPLANE ALTITUDE . . . . . . LOWEST SAFE ALTITUDE
                                                 or 10,000 FT,
                                           whichever is higher
                                    Continued on next page
                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.8.10                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                         Fire Protection
                               737 Operations Manual
                         Continued from previous page
    If smoke/fumes are uncontrollable: (continued)
       At 14,000 feet or below:
           PRESSURIZATION MODE SELECTOR . . . . . . . . MAN
           OUTFLOW VALVE SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . OPEN
             Position outflow valve to full open. This causes
             the cabin airflow to carry smoke/fumes aft.
 If packs are off and smoke/fumes source is confirmed to be
 on the flight deck:
    CAUTION: Window should not be opened unless the
             source is confirmed to be originating on the
             flight deck.
    NORMAL HOLDING AIRSPEED . . . . . . . . . . . . ESTABLISH
       [High airspeed may prevent opening the window.]

    FIRST OFFICER'S SLIDING WINDOW . . . . . . . . . . . . OPEN


                           WHEEL WELL FIRE

Condition: A fire is detected in the main wheel well.
 Observe extend limit speed (270K/.82M)
 LANDING GEAR LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DOWN
 Note: Do not use FMC fuel predictions with landing gear
       extended.
 If the landing gear must be retracted for airplane
 performance, leave the landing gear extended for 20
 minutes after the WHEEL WELL fire warning light has
 extinguished.
    LANDING GEAR LEVER (if required)
    (235 Kts maximum) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . UP & OFF
 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.


                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.

NNC.9 Non-Normal Checklists-Flight Controls
                         ALL FLAPS UP LANDING

Condition: Leading edge devices and trailing edge flaps cannot
             be extended.
  Burn off fuel to reduce touchdown speed.
  Set VREF 40 + 55 knots.
      [If tire placard speed is exceeded, tire failure may occur.]

  Check the appropriate Non-Normal Configuration Landing
  Distance table in the ADVISORY INFORMATION section of
  the Performance-Inflight chapter.
  Maintain flaps up maneuvering speed until on final.
  Limit bank angle to 15° below flaps up maneuvering speed.
  ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
  ==> DESCENT - APPROACH
  ANTI-ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
  AIR CONDITIONING &
  PRESSURIZATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
  ALTIMETERS &
  INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET & X-CHECKED
  N1 & IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED & SET,
                                                        VREF 40 + 55 KNOTS
  GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
  INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .FLAP INHIBIT
  GO-AROUND PROCEDURE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . REVIEW
    Accomplish normal go-around except:
    • Limit bank angle to 15° below flaps up maneuvering
      speed.
    • Accelerate to flaps up maneuvering speed.
                                  Continued on next page

                  ALTERNATE FLAPS OPERATION

Condition: Flaps fail to extend or retract in response to flap lever
            selection and no asymmetry is indicated.
 Plan a flaps 15 landing.
 Set VREF 15.
 Note: Asymmetry protection is not provided when the
       alternate extension system is used.
 Plan for alternate flap extension.
     [Alternate extension time to flaps 15 is approximately 2 minutes. When the
     leading edge devices have been extended by the alternate system, they
     cannot be retracted unless hydraulic system B is operational and normal
     flap operation is restored. The drag penalty with the leading edge devices
     extended may make it impossible to reach an alternate field.]
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> DESCENT - APPROACH
 ANTI-ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
 AIR COND & PRESS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
 ALTIMETERS & INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . SET & X-CHECKED
 N1 & IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .CHECKED & SET, VREF 15
 GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
 INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . FLAP INHIBIT
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.9.4                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                    Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                           Flight Controls
                                 737 Operations Manual
                           Continued from previous page
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> LANDING
 ALTERNATE FLAPS MASTER
 SWITCH (230 knots maximum) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARM
 Set flap lever to desired flap position and extend flaps on
 maneuvering speed schedule using the alternate flaps
 position switch.
 Note: The LE FLAPS TRANSIT light will remain illuminated
       until the flaps approach the flaps 10 position.
 All leading edge devices go to the FULL EXT position and
 cannot be retracted unless hydraulic system B is
 operational and normal flap operation is restored.
 ENGINE START SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
 RECALL. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED
 SPEED BRAKE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED, GREEN LIGHT
 LANDING GEAR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . DOWN, 3 GREEN
 FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 15, GREEN LIGHT

                       ASYMMETRICAL OR NO
                      LEADING EDGE DEVICES

Condition: The LE FLAPS TRANSIT light illuminated indicates
           asymmetrical or no leading edge devices.
 Plan a flaps 15 landing.
 Set VREF 15 + 5 knots.
 Limit bank angle to 15° below flaps up maneuvering speed
 Note: Do not use FMC fuel predictions with flaps extended.
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> DESCENT - APPROACH
 ANTI-ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
 AIR CONDITIONING &
 PRESSURIZATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
 ALTIMETERS &
 INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET & X-CHECKED
 N1 & IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED & SET,
                                                         VREF 15 + 5 KNOTS
 GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
 INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .FLAP INHIBIT
  ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> LANDING
 ENGINE START SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
 RECALL. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED
 SPEED BRAKE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED, GREEN LIGHT
 LANDING GEAR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . DOWN, 3 GREEN
 FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 15, AMBER LIGHT
    [With asymmetrical or no leading edge devices extended, the amber LE
    FLAPS TRANSIT Light is illuminated. On speed tape equipped airplanes,
    operation within the lower yellow airspeed band is normal for this
    condition.]

           ASYMMETRICAL TRAILING EDGE FLAPS

Condition: An uncommanded roll occurs when a new flap
            selection is made and a difference between the left
            and right flap indication is observed.
 FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
   Move flap lever to the detent nearest the smallest actual
   flap position.
 CAUTION: Do not attempt to move the trailing edge flaps
          with the alternate flaps switch as there is no
          asymmetry protection.
 If flaps 15 or more:
     Set VREF for smallest flap position.
 If flaps between 1 and 15:
     Set VREF 40 + 30 knots.
     Check the appropriate Non-Normal Configuration
     Landing Distance table in the ADVISORY INFORMATION
     section of the Performance-Inflight chapter.
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.9.8                             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                    Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                           Flight Controls
                                 737 Operations Manual
                           Continued from previous page
 If flaps less than 1:
    Use TRAILING EDGE FLAPS UP LANDING checklist.
 Note: Do not use FMC fuel predictions with flaps extended.
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> DESCENT - APPROACH
 ANTI-ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
 AIR CONDITIONING &
 PRESSURIZATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
 ALTIMETERS &
 INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET & X-CHECKED
 N1 & IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED & SET,
                                                        VREF AS REQUIRED
 GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
 INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .FLAP INHIBIT
  ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> LANDING
 ENGINE START SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
 RECALL. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED
 SPEED BRAKE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED, GREEN LIGHT
 LANDING GEAR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . DOWN, 3 GREEN
 FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ____, GREEN LIGHT


                                AUTO SLAT FAIL

Condition: The AUTO SLAT FAIL light illuminated indicates
           failure of the auto slat system.
 No crew action required in flight.




                      Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
December 06, 2002               D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                            NNC.9.9
Non-Normal Checklists -
Flight Controls
                                     737 Operations Manual




                                           Intentionally
                                               Blank




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.9.10                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                         Flight Controls
                               737 Operations Manual

              FEEL DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE

Condition: The FEEL DIFF PRESS light illuminated indicates
          significant differential pressure in the elevator feel
          computer.
 No crew action required in flight.


                          FLAP LOAD RELIEF

Condition: The FLAP LOAD RELIEF light illuminated indicates
          the flap load relief system has been activated and
          flaps are retracting from 40 to 30 due to excessive
          airspeed.
 Check flap position and maintain appropriate airspeed.


            FLIGHT CONTROL LOW PRESSURE

Condition: A FLT CONTROL LOW PRESSURE light illuminated
          indicates the related hydraulic system pressure to
          ailerons, elevators and rudder is low or the rudder
          pressure reducer has failed in the low pressure mode.
 FLIGHT CONTROL SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . STBY RUD




                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
December 06, 2002             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.9.11
Non-Normal Checklists -
Flight Controls
                                     737 Operations Manual


                          JAMMED OR RESTRICTED
                           ELEVATOR OR AILERON

Condition: Restricted movement of the elevator or
            aileron/spoiler is experienced.
 AUTOPILOT (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
 AUTOTHROTTLE (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
 Verify thrust is symmetrical.
 JAMMED OR RESTRICTED SYSTEM . . . . . . . . .OVERPOWER
   Use maximum force, including a combined effort of both
   pilots, if required. A maximum two-pilot effort on the
   controls will not cause a cable or system failure.
 Do not turn off any flight control switches.
 If controls are normal:
     Accomplish the normal DESCENT-APPROACH and
     LANDING checklists.
 If controls are not normal:
     If electric trim is desired, the Stabilizer Trim Override
     switch must be positioned to OVERRIDE.
     Do not make abrupt thrust changes. Extend or retract
     speedbrake slowly and smoothly.
     Limit bank angle to 15°.
     Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.
     Plan a flaps 15 landing.
     Set VREF 15 + 5.
                                    Continued on next page




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.9.12                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                   Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Flight Controls
                                737 Operations Manual
                          Continued from previous page
 If controls are not normal: (continued)
     ------------------------ DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
     ==> DESCENT - APPROACH
    ANTI-ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
    AIR CONDITIONING &
    PRESSURIZATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
    ALTIMETERS &
    INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET & X-CHECKED
    N1 & IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED & SET,
                                                      VREF 15 + 5 KNOTS
    GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
    INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .FLAP INHIBIT
    GO-AROUND PROCEDURE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . REVIEW
       Accomplish normal go-around procedure. Advance
       thrust to go-around smoothly and slowly to avoid
       excessive pitch-up.
    ------------------------ DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
    ==> LANDING
    ENGINE START SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
    RECALL . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED
    SPEED BRAKE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED, GREEN LIGHT
    LANDING GEAR . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . DOWN, 3 GREEN
    FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 15, GREEN LIGHT

                              JAMMED STABILIZER

Condition: The stabilizer fails to respond to electric trim inputs.

 MANUAL TRIM . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .APPLY
   Use force as needed to cause the disconnect clutch to
   disengage. Steady pressure on the manual trim handles
   is required until the desired trim is attained. A maximum
   two-pilot effort on the trim wheels will not cause a cable
   or system failure.
 Note: Handle should be folded inside stabilizer trim wheel
       when not in use.
 If the trim wheel moves when released:
     STABILIZER TRIM AUTOPILOT
     CUTOUT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOUT
         [Autopilot is not available.]

 Maintain in-trim airspeed until start of approach.
 Plan a flaps 15 landing.
 Set VREF 15.
 Establish landing configuration early.
 Note: Anticipate higher than normal elevator forces during
       approach and landing.
                                    Continued on next page

                  LEADING EDGE FLAPS TRANSIT

Condition: The LE FLAPS TRANSIT light remains illuminated.

 Note: Do not use FMC fuel predictions with flaps extended.
 If the light remains illuminated with the trailing edge flaps
 extended:
     Accomplish the ASYMMETRICAL OR NO LEADING EDGE
     DEVICES checklist.
 If the light remains illuminated with the trailing edge flaps
 up:
     AIRSPEED . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 230 KNOTS MAXIMUM
 If roll is encountered:
     Accomplish the ASYMMETRICAL OR NO LEADING EDGE
     DEVICES checklist.
 If no roll is encountered:
     Recycle flaps to flaps 1 then UP.
     If the LE FLAPS TRANSIT light extinguishes:
         Proceed normally.
     If the LE FLAPS TRANSIT light remains illuminated:
         LE DEVICES ANNUNCIATOR PANEL . . . . . . . . . CHECK
         If any light(s) for only one leading edge device is
         illuminated:
             Limit airspeed to 300 knots (280 knots for turbulent
             air penetration) or .65 Mach, whichever is lower.
         If any light(s) for more than one leading edge device is
         illuminated:
              Limit airspeed to 230 knots.
         Accomplish the ASYMMETRICAL OR NO LEADING
         EDGE DEVICES checklist for landing.

                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.9.16                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                   Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                          Flight Controls
                                737 Operations Manual

                               MACH TRIM FAIL

Condition: The MACH TRIM FAIL light illuminated indicates
          failure of the mach trim system.
 Limit airspeed to .74 Mach.


                        RUNAWAY STABILIZER

Condition: Continuing rotation of the stabilizer trim wheel in a
          manner not appropriate for flight conditions.
 CONTROL COLUMN. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . HOLD FIRMLY
 AUTOPILOT (if engaged). . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
   Do not re-engage the autopilot.
   Control airplane pitch attitude manually with control
   column and main electric trim as required.
 If runaway continues:
    STABILIZER TRIM CUTOUT
    SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CUTOUT
 If runaway continues:
    STABILIZER TRIM WHEEL . . . . . . . . . . . . .GRASP & HOLD
    STABILIZER . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .TRIM MANUALLY
    Anticipate trim requirements.
    Complete the normal DESCENT-APPROACH and
    LANDING checklists.
    Establish proper airspeed and in-trim condition early on
    final approach.




                     Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
December 06, 2002              D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.9.17
Non-Normal Checklists -
Flight Controls
                                     737 Operations Manual

                                      SPEED BRAKE

Condition: The flashing SPEED BRAKE light illuminated
            indicates the speed brakes are up while in the landing
            configuration.
 SPEED BRAKE
 LEVER . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED/DOWN DETENT (AS REQUIRED)


                     SPEED BRAKE DO NOT ARM

Condition: The SPEED BRAKE DO NOT ARM light illuminated
            indicates a fault in the automatic speed brake system.
 Note: Speed brakes may be used in flight.
 Complete the normal DESCENT-APPROACH and LANDING
 checklists except do not arm speed brakes for landing.
 Manually deploy the speed brakes immediately upon
 touchdown.


                                   SPEED TRIM FAIL

Condition: The SPEED TRIM FAIL light illuminated indicates
            failure of the speed trim system.
 No crew action required in flight.




                          Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
NNC.9.18                            D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                  December 06, 2002
                                                                                  Non-Normal Checklists -
                                                                                         Flight Controls
                               737 Operations Manual

                    STABILIZER OUT OF TRIM

Condition: The STAB OUT OF TRIM light illuminated indicates
         the autopilot is not trimming the stabilizer properly.
 Note: Momentary illumination of the STAB OUT OF TRIM
       light during large changes in trim requirements is
       normal.
 If the stabilizer is not trimming:
    CONTROL COLUMN . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . HOLD FIRMLY
    AUTOPILOT . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .DISENGAGE
    STABILIZER TRIM . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED




                    Copyright © The Boeing Company. See title page for details.
December 06, 2002             D6-27370-400E-TBCE                                           NNC.9.19
Non-Normal Checklists -
Flight Controls
                                     737 Operations Manual

              TRAILING EDGE FLAPS UP LANDING

Condition: The flap position indicator remains in the UP position,
            or less than 1, when flaps 1 is selected.
 Burn off fuel to reduce touchdown speed.
 Set VREF 40 + 40 knots.
 Check the appropriate Non-Normal Configuration Landing
 Distance table in the ADVISORY INFORMATION section of
 the Performance-Inflight chapter.
 Maintain 210 knots until on final.
 Limit bank angle to 15° below 210 knots.
 ---------------------------- DEFERRED ITEMS ------------------------------
 ==> DESCENT - APPROACH
 ANTI-ICE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . AS REQUIRED
 AIR CONDITIONING &
 PRESSURIZATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET
 ALTIMETERS &
 INSTRUMENTS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . SET & X-CHECKED
 N1 & IAS BUGS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED & SET,
                                                     VREF 40 + 40 KNOTS
     [A nuisance stick shaker may occur when slowing to VREF 40 + 40 at high
     gross weights and/or bank angles greater than 15°.]

 GROUND PROXIMITY FLAP
 INHIBIT SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . FLAP INHIBIT
 GO-AROUND PROCEDURE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . REVIEW
   Accomplish normal go-around except:
   • Limit bank angle to 15 ° below 210 knots.
   • Accelerate to 210 knots.
   • Do not exceed 230 knots with leading edge flaps
     extended.

 ==> LANDING
 ALTERNATE FLAPS MASTER SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARM
 ALTERNATE FLAPS POSITION
 SWITCH (230 knots maximum) . . . . . . . .MOMENTARY DOWN
   Verify leading edge devices annunciator indicates FULL
   EXT.
 Note: The LE FLAPS TRANSIT light will remain illuminated.
 ENGINE START SWITCHES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
 RECALL. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . CHECKED
 SPEED BRAKE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ARMED, GREEN LIGHT

 FLAPS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .UP, AMBER LIGHT
    [On speed tape equipped airplanes, operation within the lower yellow
    airspeed band is normal for this condition.]

 FASTEN BELTS SWITCH . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
